Fragmenting proteins¶

AFprep_func.recursive_fragment_finding.check_valid_cutpoint(res, domains, sequence_end)¶

Checks if a cutpoint is valid based on the specified conditions.

Parameters: - res (int): The position to check for a valid cutpoint. - domains (list of Domain): The list of domain objects. - sequence_end (int): The end position of the protein sequence.

Returns: - bool: True if the cutpoint is valid, False otherwise.

AFprep_func.recursive_fragment_finding.find_next_start(res, overlap, max_overlap, min_overlap, domains, last_res)¶
AFprep_func.recursive_fragment_finding.recursive_fragmentation(domains, fragment_start, first_res, last_res, min_len, max_len, overlap, max_overlap, min_overlap, cutpoints=None, overlaps=None)¶
